That AR is for cinema. When you convert a movie for tv you can put it in a letterbox or you can crop it to fit the 16:9 format. It's a choice and I think that it is depends on the movie. 
Very often it is obvious that the makers have made the movie to be croped for television.
Excuse me, this movie I have put in a letterbox to keep the original AR and to put some of the hardcoded subtitle under the movie.

My comments disappear, so once again, that AR is for cinema. In a tv-version you can crop the movie or let i be with black borders to fit tv (16:9=1280x720) . You can put black borders directly in the movie like I did here to make the hardcoded subtitles fit better.
